title: data

env.label: Host
env.name: HOST

name: data
note: This wapp provides access to all databases deployed by other wapps. To secure access to this sensible wapp, it is exposed exclusively via the HTTPS_MGMT_PORT as configured in the .env file of your wappster instance

title: dns
description: DNS-level ad blocker based on Pi-hole

env.description: The DNS hostname pointing to this app
env.label: Host
env.name: HOST

env.description: IP of the primary upstream DNS provider, i.e. 1.1.1.1
env.label: Primary DNS
env.name: DNS1

env.description: IP of the secondary upstream DNS provider, i.e. 1.0.0.1
env.label: Secondary DNS
env.name: DNS2

env.description: The server IP listening to DNS and DHCP requests
env.label: Server IP
env.name: IP

env.description: Initial administrator password, please change after first login
env.label: Password
env.name: PASSWORD

env.description: Time zone for this app (format: Europe/Zurich)
env.label: Time zone
env.name: TZ

env.description: Path to custom hosts file used for DNS lookup, located on your wappster instance
env.label: Hosts file
env.name: HOSTS_FILE

name: dns

title: ipam
description: IP address management (IPAM) based on Netbox

env.label: Host
env.name: HOST

env.description: The name of the database
env.label: Database
env.name: POSTGRES_DB

env.description: The name of the database user
env.label: Database user
env.name: POSTGRES_USER

env.description: The password of the database user
env.label: Database password
env.name: POSTGRES_PASSWORD

env.description: Random string required by the wapp, recommended minimum length: 50 characters
env.label: Secret key
env.name: SECRET_KEY

name: ipam
note: After deploying this wapp, you need to create a new user via the containerâ€™s command line. Inside Portainer, select the container ${NAME}_netbox_1. Connect to the container's console, execute the following command and fill in the required pieces of info (username, email address and password): python3 manage.py createsuperuser
